Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 0.22 nm (based on crystallographic structure), varies up to 0.49 nm due to disordered ethyl groups
Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: 1D channels with deformed hexagonal/narrow elliptical windows, connected to form a 3D microporous network

Other Information.Additional Info: CO2 permeance much lower than H2; H2/CO2 selectivity ~80.2

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale facilitated by flexible lattice structure of MAF-5

Experimental Validation.Method: Single gas permeation experiments and binary gas separation tests using a Wicke-Kallenbach cell
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: H2/CO2 selectivity: ~80.2 (single gas), ~63.1 (binary mixture); H2/N2 selectivity: ~87.1 (single gas), ~66.5 (binary mixture); H2/CH4 selectivity: ~105.2 (single gas), ~81.2 (binary mixture)

Other Information.Additional Info: The ZnO nanorods layer acted as an intermediate between the substrate and MAF-5 membrane, enhancing adhesion and stability. Long-term stability tested for 240 h without performance degradation.
